snippet: The first annual Substitute Teacher Appreciation Week begins today, honoring those who, in its founder's phrase, ''get no sick days or respect.'' Is it really that bad? To find out, we called Paul Emus of Imperial Beach, Calif., a typical sub whos...
lead_paragraph: The first annual Substitute Teacher Appreciation Week begins today, honoring those who, in its founder's phrase, ''get no sick days or respect.'' Is it really that bad? To find out, we called Paul Emus of Imperial Beach, Calif., a typical sub whose four years in various southern California school districts inspired ''Not Young Enought to Know Everything,'' a self-published book of tips for fellow sufferers. Emus admits to being ambivalent about sub life; intrigued, we asked him to blend his experiences into a composite day. A composite worst day.
abstract: Paul Emus, who has been substitute teacher in various southern California school districts for last four years, blends his experiences into composite worst day for a substitute; drawings (M)

headline.main: A Day in the Life of Ivan Subovitch
